page.title: 04Vimy Ridge- Kinoulton
page.content:
Until 1919 the Nevile family owned all the land around Kinoulton
including what we now call{Vimy Ridge. Vimy Ridge Farm was called Pasture Hills Farm and was farmed by the Keyworth family. When the Nevile family sold off the estate a man named{Sir Jesse Hind bought Pasture Hills Farm.He had a son who went to fight in the 1st World War and was killed at the Battle of Vimy Ridge. Sir Jesse Hind had an avenue of poplar trees planted in memory of his son and this was called{Vimy Ridge}and Pasture Hills Farm became Vimy Ridge Farm.The poplar trees can be seen for miles around and are a well-known{ landmark. Vimy Ridge Farm is now derelict.
